alert.note: Alert for Baker County; Malheur County (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Boise (Southwestern Idaho and Eastern Oregon)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 11 at 2:44PM PDT by NWS Boise
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Baker and north central Malheur Counties through 415 PM MDT/315 PM PDT/... At 344 PM MDT/244 PM PDT/, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Cow Valley, or 30 miles south of Baker City, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Malheur Reservoir, Brogan Hill Summit and Malheur City around 350 PM MDT. California Mountain around 400 PM MDT. Rye Valley and Weatherby around 310 PM PDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
